subject: Re: [junit] Trouble with my Ant build integration
msgSnippet: ... If you look at the stack trace, it is netbean s classloader that refuses to load classes from the default package, not Ant. Maybe Ant should discourage the
messageBody:
On Wed, 25 Feb 2004, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> thomascrownxoxo wrote:
>
> > Will not load classes from default package
> > java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Will not load classes from
> > default package
>
> Ant is trying to tell you "don't do that." Put your tests in a
> package of some kind.

If you look at the stack trace, it is netbean's classloader that
refuses to load classes from the default package, not Ant.

Maybe Ant should discourage the default package as well, but it
doesn't do so yet.

Stefan
--
http://stefanbodewig.blogger.de/
